remarks: If there is a cofinal map from ` B ` to ` A ` , then ` B ` is at least ` ( cf `` A ) ` .  This theorem and ~ cff1 motivate the picture of ` ( cf `` A ) ` as the greatest lower bound of the domain of cofinal maps into ` A ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Feb-2013.)
statement:
cfflb $p |- ( ( A e. On /\ B e. On ) -> ( E. f ( f : B --> A /\ A. z e. A E. w e. B z C_ ( f ` w ) ) -> ( cf ` A ) C_ B ) ) $.
$d A f w z $.
$d B f w z $.
